#summary Golf Markup Language Reference: TeesRef.

= Description =

The TeesRef element allow to copy information from another set of Tees. The set of  Tees from which the information is copied is specified in the element's value. The information copied over is specified by the `direction` attribute.

= Attributes =

The element has the following attributes:

# direction - An indication of what is copied from the referenced set of Tees.

== Direction Attribute Domain and Domain Values ==


= Elements = 

None.


= Example of Use =

=== Different Sets of Tees with Same Par and Handicap Information ===

Definition of a first set of Tees:
{{{
<tees id="tees-1" color="black">
  <qualification handicap-method="usga">
    <par>72.8</par>
    <deviation>136</deviation>
  </qualification>
  <tee number="1">
    <par>4</par>
    <length>403</length>
    <handicap>9</handicap>
  </tee>
   ...
</tees>
}}}

Definition of a second set of Tees, same par and handicap values, different lengths only:
{{{
<tees id="tees-2" color="white">
  <qualification handicap-method="usga">
    <par>70.8</par>
    <deviation>120</deviation>
  </qualification>
  <tees-ref direction="both">tees-1</tees-ref>
   <tee number="1">
     <length>375</length>
   </tee>
   ...
</tees>
}}}

=== Example 2: Multiple 9 Hole Courses Combined into Multiple 18 Hole Course ===

Definition of three 9 Hole courses:
{{{
<course id="course-1" holes="9">
    <name>First Nine</name>
    <tees id="tees-1" color="black">
        <tee number="1">
            <par>4</par>
            <length>403</length>
            <handicap>9</handicap>
        </tee>
    </tees>
</course>

<course id="course-1" holes="9">
    <name>Second Nine</name>
    <tees id="tees-2" color="black">
        <tee number="1">
            <par>3</par>
            <length>188</length>
            <handicap>6</handicap>
        </tee>
    </tees>
</course>

<course id="course-1" holes="9">
    <name>Third Nine</name>
    <tees id="tees-2" color="black">
        <tee number="1">
            <par>4</par>
            <length>388</length>
            <handicap>12</handicap>
        </tee>
    </tees>
</course>
}}}


Definition of 18 Holes courses based on the above 9 Hole courses:
{{{
<course id="course-4">
    <name>First Eighteen</name>
    <tees id="tees-4" color="black">
        <qualification handicap-method="usga">
            <par>73.5</par>
            <deviation>143</deviation>
        </qualification>
        <tees-ref direction="front">tees-1</tees-ref>
        <tees-ref direction="back">tees-2</tees-ref>
        <tee number="1">
            <handicap>11</handicap>
        </tee>
        ...
   </tees>
</course>
}}}

The attribute `direction` specified as front or back copies par and distance elements. Individual Tee element complete the definition of Tees with handicap elements only.
